page.title: 13WADDINGTON FIRE-STATION
page.content: There are 11 part-time firemen in Waddington and one fire-engine. The fire-engine is going to be replaced soon because it has travelled more than 8,000 miles. The fire-station was built in 1950. It serves an area of 4 square miles and is called upon about 100 times each year. The firemen practice once a week for two hours. They are paid Â£1,500 per year. All the men have other jobs. One owns a flower shop, another owns a hardware shop, there is a lorry driver, a bus driver, a barber, a plumber and a bricklayer. When needed the men are called up to the fire-station by a bleeper. Only six men are needed, so they have dogtags with numbers on. When they come they pick up a dogtag and when the seventh man arives he will know that he will not be needed.
